page.title: 12HOME LIFE
page.content: Pilgrims Hatch is the largest private housing area. Many of the houses are fairly modern semi-detached bungalows, although most roads contain brick and pebble-dashed inter-war houses with tiled roofs and casement windows. The cost of a three-bedroomed semi-detached house is Â£40-50,000.All have garages. Also,in Hatch Road there are some older terraces of former farmworkers' cottages which have been modernized.The gardens are well kept, but the general appearance of the roads is spoilt by the large number of telephone wires and telegraph poles. Most occupants have white-collar jobs, managerial,lecturing,teaching and accounting. Almost every family has at least one car,a T.V.,a fridge and a video.All have bathrooms and inside toilets.
